SENT.plain: The oral flora of patients with Behçet's disease was investigated and compared to that of controls
The proportion of Streptococcus (S.) sanguis in the flora of patients with this disease was always higher than that of healthy controls
It is noteworthy that serotypes of S. sanguis in the oral flora of patients were different from controls
Immune responses against S. sanguis were also examined in the patients
Antibody titers against S. sanguis were higher in patients than in controls
Furthermore, the patients showed significantly increased skin reactivity to S. sanguis
These results suggest that uncommon serotypes of S. sanguis play an important role in the pathogenesis of Behçet's disease
